intro: Gonolobus leianthus, commonly known as the Hawaiian coral vine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine, often found in coastal and lowland habitats. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color, with a distinctive corolla shape. Gonolobus leianthus plays a role in local ecosystems and has cultural significance to Native Hawaiian communities.
